column4: and gives a more natural look.The pictures are lineups of all of the foundations and the one I’m reviewing is moved forward so you can tell the difference. Please excuse the background

column6: but if it isn’t it’s extremely annoying that Maybelline would mislabel the foundation like this. 110 is almost exactly my skin tone and 120 is what I use if I have a tan.Second pic is the lids

column8: 110 matte+poreless
column10: 330. I have a bit of a tan on my arm now from driving
column11: so I’m getting into my summer shade on my arm (face is lighter) but you can pretty clearly see that this 110 is WAY darker than the actual 110 matte+poreless and a bit darker than 120 dewy+smooth. It’s also more of an orangey shade than the 120 is. DEFINITELY NOT PORCELAIN. (Again
column12: the 330 is a contour shade so chill lol)The fourth pic is the same as the 3rd
column13: just at my vanity so you can see it under different lighting.The fifth pic is the backs of each. You can clearly see the difference in labeling. I will say: the shade 120 that I have has different labeling from all of them
column14: so I’m guessing that is a change by Maybelline
column15: and I’m very willing to accept that 120 is a possible knock off (I also ordered on Amazon)

column1:

Matte everything is the big trend at the moment
column2: and a matte foundation is the perfect thing for us oily skinned ladies. This product certainly reduces the appearance of pores and provides great coverage
column3: however I find that it refuses to stay put on my face no matter what primer and setting spray I use. It moves around on your face a lot and slides off very easily. So overall I'd say it's a fairly average product that looks good when first applied but certainly won't stay looking that way all day.

column2: but because I love matte foundation and have tried a few that have been suggested to me and They have failed
column3: I decided to try this one
column4: and omg I LOVE this
column5: it's so good on my skin and it doesn't irritate me either. It's not cakey and I wore it for a few hours one day without setting spray and it was still fine when I got home :) I find it blends really well also. It is pricier then some I've used but it's my #1 foundation at the moment :)

column1: This foundation is my first try of Maybelline. Maybellines one of those brands you can easily online or at most chain stores. When they launched this new line last year I was interested to see what this would be like. I purchased this in a bulk lot from Trade me because I like bargain hunting. Typically in New Zealand foundations can be priced medium to high range. Theres always other ways to try and find foundations and at an affordable rate like at Red Bucket sales etc. My skin type is dry combination with large pores. I get acne every time I try a new foundation or skincare product. Thankfully not with this one.
I have dry skin
column2: always have
column3: but I was having no luck with foundations that were targeted at dry skin. Whilst in Hawaii early last year I saw this
column4: it was cheap as chips so I thought I'd take the plunge and try something that's the polar opposite of what I normally go for. Boy am I glad I did!

column1: I am quite pale and ivory was too dark for me in this range
column2: it sat really badly on my skin
column3: pooling in areas and looking cakey.  I was quite disappointed as I had heard so many great things about this
column4: with me it's either hit or miss and this was definately a miss.

column1: I have recently learned from a BR pro lovely that my skin is not dry and sensitive like I previously was told.  It's combination and can be quite oily in the T Zone area.  I previously used the Fit Me dewy finish because I thought the shining dewy look was better for my dry skin.  But little did I know that although in places it looked good in the oily areas it made it even oilier.
I wear this at night when I go out
column2: its cheap enough and does the job. My friend let me use hers one time and I just had to go out and get it as well as the  smooth and dewy foundation for during the day :) Great range of colours and blends in nicely.

column1: I have very visible pores but Im not a big fan of silicone primers. I dont even need to use a primer with this. One of my favourites so far it keeps me matte all day
column2: covers up my pores and has pretty good coverage. The price is good considering what you get. I'd repurchase again definitely!

column1: After reading all the fuss about the original Fit Me foundation
column2: I decided to give the matte and pore-less version a try. And I love it! I love the medium-full coverage
column3: I love the way it sits on my skin and bigger pores
column4: and I love how it covers my acne.The only thing is the colour choice with Maybelline is hit or miss when it comes to their lighter shade
column5: I feel I'm in between Ivory and Classic Ivory.

column1: i used to wear the original fit me and then tried the matte+pore one and it went matte far to quickly i didn't get a chance to apply it to my skin properly and it went all patchy. then i tried a friends one a few days later and it dried after i have applied it to my skin and smoothed it out?
I can't get enough of this foundation. I'm on my third bottle! It's so easy to blend out with buildable
column2: medium coverage. It stays matte long enough for every day and is fairly affordable too. I took one lippie off for not having a pump on the bottle - if other Maybelline foundations have pumps why not this one?

column1: I initially was not the biggest fan of this foundation. I at first found that this didnt sit right on my skin
column2: and highlighted my large pores. After some experimentation however this foundation has certainly grown on me. I find that you need a well hydrated base
column3: and a good pore filling primer. With these steps in place this foundation then provides a really pretty matte medium/full coverage
column4: which I find lasts all day without looking cakey or shiny.

column1: I really like this foundation
column2: however I'm between colours which is really annoying. It also would be better if it had a pump bottle. It gives a buildable coverage and is matte but not too matte. Lasts pretty well and doesn't get too oily on me.

column1: I love love love this foundation. I have tried so many different foundations that promise you perfection but this one doesn't lie. It matches perfectly too. Will definitely be buying this again.

I bought this foundation at one of the makeup sales as I had been looking at it for a while and wanted a cheap everyday foundation. I found the colours for lighter skinned ladies are either too grey or too pink. I went for the more grey option as my skin is already quite pink but it still wasn't quite the right colour (maybe I need to try a different colour). I found the coverage was medium which is good for everyday wear for me but I would choose a more high coverage foundation for the weekend. It is a fairly matte formula but I still use a light powder as my skin can be quite oily towards the end of the day. I will mix with another foundation to use the bottle but probably wouldn't purchase again.
I picked this up a few months ago as I was curious with the matte formula. I've tried the original Fit Me foundation years ago and although I liked it then
column2: it wasn't the best for my oily skin.

column1: Consult a skin doctor

Great video. She’s so beautiful. I’d like to share this on here knowing that there will be quite a bit of viewers who may suffer from acne. This is from research and from my own experience. Acne is usually hormonal and can’t be treated with topicals. You need a combination of birth control pills that help regulate your hormones and Spironolactone (you’ll need a prescription from your doctor) which helps control your body’s production of androgens which causes acne. I’ve suffered from hormonal acne most of my 20’s until I started this medication regime. This is the only thing that works! So if you have severe acne

column1: Let me just say this i have suffered w acne for ten years and it left me w horrible scars i have tryed dermatologist prescribed products and they never worked what worked was Neutrogena on the spot acne treatment i apply it over my cheeks and chin (where i mostly have acne) all over not just spots every night before bed after i wash my face and it worked great so far i have been using it for five years and it is great!  It helps control my break outs i rarely get like one pimple i use it to control it i say bc when i stop my face starts breaking out again i also suffer w acne prone skin ( let me just say this start out w once every three days bc it will dry the heck out of your skin it will peel alot n turn pink until your skin get used to the products which takes a long time i don't rember how long bc it's been so long but at least four months now when i use it wout fail everyday i don't get peel or pink skin anymore only if it gets on my neck by accident i get it on my neck and after it dries which takes about 10-15 min i apply aloe lotion for oily skin i hope it helps have a great day (from a fellow acne sufferer).

Hi! My son had the same kind of acne as you when he was younger..we tried everything for several years..nothing worked. It would clear and come back worse than before with some of prescribed creams. Finally i had the opportunity to ask an estetician
column2: he told me baking soda wash 3 per day. Equal parts of water and baking soda by making a paste and using it as a facial scrub. Secondly
column3: he said to follow up with organic raw apple cider vinegar 25% &  distilled water mixture 75% toner. It worked. We kept in refridgerator. He saw results within 2 weeks. He then started to cut back
column4: To twice a day until it cleared. This was 8 years ago. The scaring is minimal.  He maintains once a day in shower still to this day! His acne is gone forever now. Keep following up wth a water based moisturizer like you are. I really hope this helps you and understand this is not a dis to you at all in any way shape or form!  Your makeup looks great! God Bless!

FYI -- when she said in regards to the bottle of makeup
column2: that she's hearing something 'rattling' around inside of the bottle of makeup --  it most likely is a 'small silver weighted ball' that is placed inside the bottle by the manufacturer.  It's so that the makeup stirs well when you're shaking the bottle.  They also use them in cans of hairspray -- cans of spray paint
column3:
etc.

I wear and love Maybelline Cosmetics -- I've used their line of cosmetics for over 20 years! Not a lot of people know that "Maybelline" mascara was the very first lash darkening product that came out. The story goes that a young man was watching his older sister use black charcoal dust on her wet lashes and from seeing that -- Maybelline Mascara was born!

Maybelline Mascara used to come in a flat pink plastic box container with a small 'toothbrush' looking brush and you would have to dampen the brush and swish it around in the dry black color and then paint your lashes with the brush and let them dry.

Maybelline Cosmetics have been selling its cosmetics for over 100 years! And
column4:
the only way to stick around for that long -- is by being one of the best cosmetic manufacturers there is!

The "Pink and Green" Maybelline mascara is one of the best on the market -- if you watch any professional makeup artists -- you will find that they have tubes and tubes of the "Pink and Green" Maybelline mascara on hand!

column1: When I was 21 I had a horrible breakout on the lower sides of my face. I came across some neutrogena at my ex’s brothers house and tried it. My skin cleared in a week or two but I saw results everyday . Here’s my advice. For severe acne wash your face 3x with a deep cleaning neutrogena that contains alpha and beta hydroxy acid. DO NOT put any type of moisturizer on EVER. Your skin neeeds to dry out. Putting moisturizer and makeup in inflamed pores filled with dirt and bacteria is devastation 🤦‍♀️ My skin routine is so dope I can skip days of using my products and my skin stays clear. I also aged better. Since neutrogena discontinues products every couple of years I noticed the common denominator of each new product that I found worked for me was a deep cleaner that contains the two acids even if I have to find 2 different washes and combine them in my skin routine. Also
column2: I never ever use rags on my face or pat dry after. I love makeup but when I don’t wear it I get compliments that I look better without it. Recently my mom told my sister I look flawless and my cousin saw me and told me my skin is soft like a baby’s butt. Things I never heard before. Conclusion; if your going to wear makeup anyway do a power wash in the  am.  (Wet face
column3: Rub product with a dap of water
column4: until it gets foamy. Rub in circles around your whole face for about 30 secs
column5: wash with warm water repeat 2 or 3x) Apply makeup. As soon as you get home power wash with the same routine. At night do another power wash. Eventually you’ll have to do less and less. It’s amazing. Once your skin is under control you can start dabbling in different types of lotions but don’t get happy. Also doing it in a steamy shower gives you faster and better quality results  I hope this article changes a lot of lives because my breakout was nasty but once I found a routine I realized it gives my skin a better smoother toned complexion. No pores good luck!! If you try my routine for about a month reply your results.

I had very bad acne as a teenager. In college my anatomy professor said that some people's acne is caused by all the chemicals we put on our face that can irritate it. I don't put any cleansers on my face and I'm careful about what moisturizer to use. All I do is exfoliate with a clean exfoliating glove. Usually foundation doesnt bother my skin. Some primers cause me breakouts so I always check reviews first and watch to see if I react to it. I tried accutane which didn't help and all kinds of other prescriptions. The only thing that stopped my breakouts was to stop putting all the stuff on my face. Might be something to try

The condition of your gut dictates the condition of your skin.  Improve gut health and you correct skin problems.  Why?  The skin often tries to eliminate toxic burden that cannot be eliminated any other way but through your skin.  Anyone with skin problems should drink 1 gallon of water per day and eliminate sugar intake ENTIRELY.  Add l-glutamine to your diet to help improve gut health and take probiotics to help reduce toxin production.  Ozone water applied to infected areas several times per day is much more effective and gentler than benzoyl peroxide

You are beautiful and do your make up very well! I'm going to share a little bit of info about my personal cystic acne journey and maybe it will help someone on here. I get so sick of ppl saying go on Accutane or try B.C. Now the only thing that worked for me was realizing that my body was trying to let me know it was having a hard time digesting foods I was eating
column2: even when I went dairy and meat free!!  Basically when your stomach acid is too low your body has a hard time digesting almost every food you eat and needs a little help breaking food down or you will see break outs on your face...your digestive system is trying to tell you something. My acne pretty much dried up and disappeared after I started taking betaine hcl supplements from the natural foods market in my area. You can also get them on Amazon. What they do is help raise stomach acid levels so your digestive system can break foods down easier. Its super simple and effective but not many ppl know about it so plz do your research. I take one capsule with ever meal and drink plenty of water...and I can eat breads
column3: chocolate
column4: and soy products again without crazy break outs. I also take an apple cider vinegar pill along side the betaine hcl to help break my food down even further for easier digestion. I also switched over to a hypoallergenic aloe Vera face wash free from perfumes and harsh chemicals. It worked for me and I hope someone sees this and decides to do some research bc my results were awesome. Acne does not make anyone any less beautiful
column5: your digestive system is just asking for a little help. 🙌💜🌹

I used to have acne and I was on and off accutane for about 6 years. Low dose - about 10mg. I tried doxycycline at one stage but it was actually a lot harsher than accutane on my skin and I had serious issues with sun damage - I would never recommend it over accutane. At the beginning of last year I decided I was sick of accutane and did not want to spend my life on it because I worried about my health (but my skin looked AMAZING when I was on it). I went off it and after about a month my acne returned and my oil production was absolutely out of control. I have finally found a really great brand of skincare that operates to penetrate below the epidermal layer and my skin is pretty much as good as it was when I was on accutane (although I still produce more oil than when I was on it). I definitely think it is a good idea to talk to somebody who knows a thing or two about skin care - curology sounds like a really good source for that. I know how hard it is to live with acne
column2: it destroys confidence. But thank you for creating a YouTube channel and being so honest about it! And for being so graceful when people comment “use apple cider vinegar” or “you need to wash your face every night” - don’t you know we do that!!?? Acne is a medical condition - it ain’t linked to hygiene because I wash and moisturize my face religiously and have done so since I was in my teens! All the best for your journey and I hope you continue to create great content!

Please blot and take away the oil first and then powder. Blot with blotting paper or a tissue and the use a brush or puff to reapply powder because putting powder on your puff and directly on top of the oil will cause the bacteria to be on the puff. And then you put the put back in the powder to get more which transfers bacteria on the powder itself and your face.
